classdef.shortdesc: The $ object provides a number of debugging facilities and informational methods.

property.name: error
property.shortdesc: The most recent run-time error information.
property.description: Assigning error text to this property generates a run-time error; however, the preferred way to generate a run-time error is to throw an Error object.

property.name: version
property.shortdesc: The version number of the ExtendScript engine.
property.description: Formatted as a three-part number and description; for example: "3.92.95 (debug)".

property.name: build
property.shortdesc: The ExtendScript build information.

property.name: buildDate
property.shortdesc: The ExtendScript build date.

property.name: global
property.shortdesc: A reference to the global object, which contains the JavaScript global namespace.

property.name: stack
property.shortdesc: The current stack trace.

property.name: level
property.shortdesc: The current debugging level, which enables or disables the JavaScript debugger.
property.description: One of 0 (no debugging), 1 (break on runtime errors), or 2 (full debug mode).

property.name: flags
property.shortdesc: Gets or sets low-level debug output flags.
property.description:
A logical AND of bit flag values:
0x0002 (2): Displays each line with its line number as it is executed.
0x0040 (64): Enables excessive garbage collection. Usually, garbage collection starts when the number of objects has increased by a certain amount since the last garbage collection. This flag causes ExtendScript to garbage collect after almost every statement. This impairs performance severely, but is useful when you suspect that an object gets released too soon.
0x0080 (128): Displays all calls with their arguments and the return value.
0x0100 (256): Enables extended error handling (see strict).
0x0200 (512): Enables the localization feature of the toString method. Equivalent to the localize property.

property.name: strict
property.shortdesc: Sets or clears strict mode for object modification.
property.description: When true, any attempt to write to a read-only property causes a runtime error. Some objects do not permit the creation of new properties when true.

property.name: locale
property.shortdesc: Gets or sets the current locale.
property.description:
The string contains five characters in the form LL_RR, where LL is an ISO 639 language specifier, and RR is an ISO 3166 region specifier.
Initially, this is the value that the application or the platform returns for the current user. You can set it to temporarily change the locale for testing. To return to the application or platform setting, set to undefined, null, or the empty string.

property.name: localize
property.shortdesc: Set to true to enable the extended localization features of the built-in toString() method.

property.name: decimalPoint
property.shortdesc: The character used as the decimal point character in formatted numeric output.

property.name: memCache
property.shortdesc: The ExtendScript memory cache size, in bytes.

property.name: screens
property.shortdesc: An array of objects containing information about the display screens attached to your computer.
property.description:
Each object has the properties left, top, right, bottom, which contain the four corners of each screen in global coordinates.
A property primary is true if that object describes the primary display.

property.name: os
property.shortdesc: The current operating system version information.

property.name: fileName
property.shortdesc: The file name of the current script.

property.name: line
property.shortdesc: The current line number of the currently executing script.

property.name: hiresTimer
property.shortdesc: A high-resolution timer, measuring the time in microseconds. The timer starts when ExtendScript is initialized during the application startup sequence. Every read access resets the timer to Zero.

property.name: engineName
property.shortdesc: The name of the current ExtendScript engine, if set.

property.name: includePath
property.shortdesc: The path for include files for the current script.

method.name: about
method.shortdesc: Shows an About box for the ExtendScript component, and returns the text for the box.

method.name: toString
method.shortdesc: Converts this object to a string.

method.name: write
method.shortdesc: Prints text to the Console.

parameter.name: text
parameter.shortdesc: The text to print. All arguments are concatenated.

method.name: writeln
method.shortdesc: Prints text to the Console, and adds a newline character.

parameter.name: text
parameter.shortdesc: The text to print. All arguments are concatenated.

method.name: bp
method.shortdesc: Breaks execution at the current position.

parameter.name: condition
parameter.shortdesc: A string containing a JavaScript statement to be used as a condition. If the statement evaluates to true or nonzero when this point is reached, execution stops.

method.name: getenv
method.shortdesc: Retrieves the value of an environment variable.

parameter.name: name
parameter.shortdesc: The name of the variable.

method.name: setenv
method.shortdesc: Sets the value of an environment variable.

parameter.name: name
parameter.shortdesc: The name of the variable.

parameter.name: value
parameter.shortdesc: The value of the variable.

method.name: sleep
method.shortdesc: Suspends the calling thread for a number of milliseconds.
method.description: During a sleep period, checks at 100 millisecond intervals to see whether the sleep should be terminated. This can happen if there is a break request, or if the script timeout has expired.

parameter.name: msecs
parameter.shortdesc: Number of milliseconds to sleep.

method.name: colorPicker
method.shortdesc: Invokes the platform-specific color selection dialog, and returns the selected color.

parameter.name: color
parameter.shortdesc: The color to be preselected in the dialog, as 0xRRGGBB, or -1 for the platform default.

method.name: evalFile
method.shortdesc: Loads and evaluates a file.

parameter.name: file
parameter.shortdesc: The file to load.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.shortdesc: An optional timeout in milliseconds.

method.name: gc
method.shortdesc: Initiates garbage collection in the ExtendScript engine.

classdef.name: Object
classdef.shortdesc: The base class of all JavaScript objects.

method.name: Object
method.shortdesc: Creates and returns a new object of a given type.

parameter.name: what
parameter.shortdesc: The object type.

method.name: isValid
method.shortdesc: Reports whether an object is still valid.

parameter.name: what
parameter.shortdesc: The object to check.

property.name: prototype
property.shortdesc: Points to the prototype object for this object.
property.description: Note that this property is treated as an XML element in the XML class.

property.name: constructor
property.shortdesc: Points to the constructor function that created this object.
property.description: Note that this property is treated as an XML element in the XML class.

property.name: reflect
property.shortdesc: Retrieves and returns the Reflection object associated with this method or a property.
property.description: Note that this property is treated as an XML element in the XML class.

method.name: toString
method.shortdesc: Creates and returns a string representing this object.
method.description: Many objects (such as Date) override this method in favor of their own implementation. If an object has no string value and no user-defined toString() method, the default method returns [object type], where type is the object type or the name of the constructor function that created the object.

method.name: toLocaleString
method.shortdesc: Creates and returns a string representing this object, localized for the current locale. See toString().

method.name: hasOwnProperty
method.shortdesc: Reports whether a given property is defined with an instance or within the prototype chain.

parameter.name: name
parameter.shortdesc: The name of the property to check.

method.name: propertyIsEnumerable
method.shortdesc: Reports whether a given property is enumerable.

parameter.name: name
parameter.shortdesc: The name of the property to check.

method.name: isPrototypeOf
method.shortdesc: Checks whether the given object is a prototype of this object.

parameter.name: what
parameter.shortdesc: The object to check.

method.name: valueOf
method.shortdesc: Retrieves and returns the primitive value of this object.
method.description: If the object has no primitive value, returns the object itself. Note that you rarely need to call this method yourself. The JavaScript interpreter automatically invokes it when encountering an object where a primitive value is expected.

method.name: toSource
method.shortdesc: Creates and returns a string representation of this object.
method.description: This function serializes the object, so that it can, for example, be passed between engines. Pass the returned string back to eval() to recreate the object. Works only with built-in classes.

method.name: unwatch
method.shortdesc: Removes the watch function of a property.

parameter.name: name
parameter.shortdesc: The name of the property to unwatch.

method.name: watch
method.shortdesc: Adds a watch function to a property, which is called when the value changes.
method.description: This function can accept, modify, or reject a new value that the user, application, or a script has attempted to place in a property.

parameter.name: name
parameter.shortdesc: The name of the property to watch.

parameter.name: func
parameter.shortdesc: The function to be called when the value of this property changes.
parameter.description:
This function must three arguments, and return as its result the value to be stored in the property. The arguments are:
name: the name of the property that changes.
oldValue: The old property value.
newValue: The new property value that was specified.

classdef.name: Array
classdef.shortdesc: An array with integer indexing and a length property.

method.name: Array
method.shortdesc: Creates and returns a new array.
method.description: Takes any number of parameters, which become the elements of the array, or a single value which becomes the length of an empty array. Note that you cannot create a one-element array, as the single parameter value is interpreted as the length. Returns the new array.

parameter.name: length
parameter.shortdesc: If no other parameters are passed, the initial length of the empty array.
parameter.description: Otherwise, the first element.

parameter.name: element
parameter.shortdesc: If there is more than one parameter, the array is initialized with the given parameters.

method.example:
new Array()
new Array (length)
new Array (11, 22, 33, 44)

property.name: length
property.shortdesc: The length of the array

method.name: concat
method.shortdesc: Returns a new array created by concatenating the given values to the end of the original array.
method.description: The original array is unchanged. If an array is provided as a parameter to concat(), each of its elements are appended as separate array elements at the end of the new array. Returns a new array, the result of concatenation the given values to the end of the original array.

parameter.name: value
parameter.shortdesc: Any number of values to be added to the end of the array.
parameter.description: Can also be arrays.

method.name: join
method.shortdesc: Joins all elements of the array into a string; optionally, each element is separated by delimiter.
method.description: Returns the string containing the joined elements and delimiters.

parameter.name: delimiter
parameter.shortdesc: A string used to separate each element of the array.
parameter.description: If omitted, the array elements are separated with a comma.

method.name: reverse
method.shortdesc: Reverses the order of the elements in the array.
method.description: Returns the reversed array.

method.name: slice
method.shortdesc: Creates a new array, which contains a subset of the original array's elements.
method.description: The slice begins with the index start, and continues up to, but not including the index, end. If start or end is a negative number, the indexed is resolved counting backwards from the end of the array resulting in the element array[array. length + negativeIndex]. Returns a new array containing elements array[start] through array[end-1].

method.name: sort
method.shortdesc: Sorts the elements of the array in place, using the given function to compare to elements.
method.description: If no function is provided, the elements are sorted alphabetically. Returns no return value.

parameter.name: userFunction
parameter.shortdesc: A user-supplied function of the form userFunction(a, b) which returns less than 0 if a is greater than b, 0 if a and b are equal, and greater than 0 if b is greater than a.

method.name: pop
method.shortdesc: Removes the last element from the array, decreases the length by 1, and returns the value of the element.
method.description: Returns the value of the deleted array element.

method.name: push
method.shortdesc: Places one or more values onto the end of the array and increases length by n.
method.description: Returns the new length of the array.

parameter.name: value
parameter.shortdesc: Any number of values to be pushed onto the end of the array.

method.name: splice
method.shortdesc: Removes num elements from the array beginning with index, start.
method.description: Optionally insert new elements beginning at index start. To ensure contiguity, elements are moved up to fill in any gaps. Returns a new array containing any elements deleted from the original array.

parameter.name: start
parameter.shortdesc: The index of the first element to remove. Negative values are relative to the end of the array.

parameter.name: num
parameter.shortdesc: The number of array elements to remove, including start. If omitted, all elements from array index start to the end of the array are removed.

parameter.name: value
parameter.shortdesc: A list of one or more values to be added to the array starting at index start.
parameter.description: Must specify a value for num, to use this argument.

method.name: shift
method.shortdesc: Removes the first element from the array, decreases the length by 1, and returns the value of the element.
method.description: Returns the value of the deleted array element.

method.name: toString
method.shortdesc: Converts an array to a string and returns the string.
method.description: Yields the same result as array. join() when called without a parameter. Returns a comma-separated list of all the elements of the array.

method.name: toLocaleString
method.shortdesc: Converts an array to a string and returns the string (localized).

method.name: unshift
method.shortdesc: Adds one or more elements to the beginning of the array.
method.description: Returns the new array length.

parameter.name: value
parameter.shortdesc: The values of one or more elements to be added to the beginning of the array.

method.name: toSource
method.shortdesc: Creates a string representation of this object that can be fed back to eval() to re-create an object. Works only with built-in classes.

classdef.name: Math
classdef.shortdesc: A global object containing a set of math functions and constants.

property.name: E
property.shortdesc: Euler's constant and the base of natural logarithms.

property.name: LN10
property.shortdesc: The natural logarithm of 10.

property.name: LN2
property.shortdesc: The natural logarithm of 2.

property.name: LOG2E
property.shortdesc: The base 2 logarithm of e.

property.name: LOG10E
property.shortdesc: The base 10 logarithm of e.

property.name: PI
property.shortdesc: The ratio of the circumference of a circle to its diameter.

property.name: SQRT1_2
property.shortdesc: The reciprocal of the square root of 1/2.

property.name: SQRT2
property.shortdesc: The square root of 2.

method.name: abs
method.shortdesc: Returns the absolute value of a number.

parameter.name: x
parameter.shortdesc: A number.

method.name: acos
method.shortdesc: Returns the arc cosine(in radians) of a number.

parameter.name: x
parameter.shortdesc: A number.

method.name: asin
method.shortdesc: Returns the arc sin(in radians) of a number.

parameter.name: x
parameter.shortdesc: A number.

method.name: atan
method.shortdesc: Returns the arc tangent(in radians) of a number.

parameter.name: x
parameter.shortdesc: A number.

method.name: atan2
method.shortdesc: Returns the arc tangent of the quotient of its arguments (y/x).

parameter.name: y
parameter.shortdesc: A number.

parameter.name: x
parameter.shortdesc: A number.

method.name: ceil
method.shortdesc: Rounds the number up to the nearest integer.

parameter.name: x
parameter.shortdesc: A number.

method.name: cos
method.shortdesc: Returns the cosine of an angle provided in radians.

parameter.name: x
parameter.shortdesc: An angle, in radians.

method.name: exp
method.shortdesc: Returns Math.E raised to the power of a number.

parameter.name: x
parameter.shortdesc: A number.

method.name: floor
method.shortdesc: Rounds a number down to the nearest integer.

parameter.name: x
parameter.shortdesc: A number.

method.name: log
method.shortdesc: Returns the natural logarithm of a number.

parameter.name: x
parameter.shortdesc: A number.

method.name: max
method.shortdesc: Returns the largest of zero or more numbers.

parameter.name: value1, value2, ...
parameter.shortdesc: Numbers.

method.name: min
method.shortdesc: Returns the smallest of zero or more numbers.

parameter.name: value1, value2, ...
parameter.shortdesc: Numbers.

method.name: pow
method.shortdesc: Returns x raised to the power of y.

parameter.name: x
parameter.shortdesc: Numbers.

method.name: random
method.shortdesc: Returns a pseudo-random number from 0.0 up to but not including 1.0.

method.name: round
method.shortdesc: Rounds a number to the nearest integer.

parameter.name: x
parameter.shortdesc: A number.

method.name: sin
method.shortdesc: Returns the sine of an angle provided in radians.

parameter.name: x
parameter.shortdesc: An angle, in radians.

method.name: sqrt
method.shortdesc: Returns the square root of a number.

parameter.name: x
parameter.shortdesc: A number.

method.name: tan
method.shortdesc: Returns the tangent of an angle provided in radians.

parameter.name: x
parameter.shortdesc: An angle, in radians.

classdef.name: Date
classdef.shortdesc: A date/time object.

method.name: Date
method.shortdesc: Returns a new Date object holding the current date and time.
method.description: If parameters are supplied, returns a new Date object holding the supplied date and time.

parameter.name: year
parameter.shortdesc: The year expressed in four digits.

parameter.name: month
parameter.shortdesc: An integer value from 0 (Jan) to 11 (Dec).

parameter.name: day
parameter.shortdesc: An integer value from 1 to 31, If this argument is not supplied, its value is set to 0.

parameter.name: hours
parameter.shortdesc: An integer value from 0 (midnight) to 23 (11 PM). If this argument is not supplied, its value is set to 0.

parameter.name: min
parameter.shortdesc: An integer value from 0 to 59. If this argument is not supplied, its value is set to 0.

parameter.name: sec
parameter.shortdesc: An Integer value from 0 to 59. If this argument is not supplied, its value is set to 0.

parameter.name: ms
parameter.shortdesc: An integer value from 0 to 999. If this argument is not supplied, its value is set to 0.

method.name: parse
method.shortdesc: Parses a string, returning a new Date object. The string should be similar to the string returned bt toString().

parameter.name: text
parameter.shortdesc: The string to parse.

method.name: UTC
method.shortdesc: Returns the number of milliseconds between midnight January 1, 1970, UTC, and the specified time.

parameter.name: year
parameter.shortdesc: The year expressed in four digits, for example, 2001.
parameter.description: To indicate for a year from 1900 to 1999, you can specify a value from 0 to 99.

parameter.name: month
parameter.shortdesc: An integer value from 0 (Jan) to 11 (Dec).

parameter.name: day
parameter.shortdesc: An integer value from 1 to 31, If this argument is not supplied, its value is set to 0.

parameter.name: hours
parameter.shortdesc: An integer value from 0 (midnight) to 23 (11 PM). If this argument is not supplied, its value is set to 0.

parameter.name: min
parameter.shortdesc: An integer value from 0 to 59. If this argument is not supplied, its value is set to 0.

parameter.name: sec
parameter.shortdesc: An Integer value from 0 to 59. If this argument is not supplied, its value is set to 0.

parameter.name: ms
parameter.shortdesc: An integer value from 0 to 999. If this argument is not supplied, its value is set to 0.

method.example: Date.UTC(year , month, date, hour, min, sec, ms)

method.name: getDate
method.shortdesc: Returns the day of the month of the specified Date object in local time.

method.name: getDay
method.shortdesc: Returns the day of the week for the specified Date object in local time.
method.description: This is an integer from 0 (Sunday) to 6 (Saturday). Returns the day of the week for date.

method.name: getYear
method.shortdesc: Returns the year of the specified Date object, as a difference from 1900, in local time.

method.name: getFullYear
method.shortdesc: Returns the four digit year of the specified Date object in local time.

method.name: getHours
method.shortdesc: Returns the hour of the specified Date object in local time.

method.name: getMilliseconds
method.shortdesc: Returns the milliseconds of the specified Date object in local time.

method.name: getMinutes
method.shortdesc: Returns the minutes of the specified Date object in local time.

method.name: getMonth
method.shortdesc: Returns the month of the specified Date object in local time.

method.name: getSeconds
method.shortdesc: Returns the seconds of the specified Date object in local time.

method.name: getTime
method.shortdesc: Returns the number of milliseconds since midnight January 1,1970 UTC for the specified Date object.

method.name: getTimezoneOffset
method.shortdesc: Returns the difference in minutes between the computer's local time and UTC.

method.name: getUTCDate
method.shortdesc: Returns the day of the month of the specified Date object according to UTC.

method.name: getUTCDay
method.shortdesc: Returns the day of the week for the specified Date object according to UTC.

method.name: getUTCFullYear
method.shortdesc: Returns the four digit year of the specified Date object according to UTC.

method.name: getUTCHours
method.shortdesc: Returns the hour of the specified Date object according to UTC.

method.name: getUTCMilliseconds
method.shortdesc: Returns the milliseconds of the specified Date object according to UTC.

method.name: getUTCMinutes
method.shortdesc: Returns the minutes of the specified Date object according to UTC.

method.name: getUTCMonth
method.shortdesc: Returns the month of the specified Date object according to UTC.

method.name: getUTCSeconds
method.shortdesc: Returns the seconds of the specified Date object according to UTC.

method.name: setDate
method.shortdesc: Sets the day of the month of a specified Date object according to local time.
method.description: Returns the number of milliseconds between the new date and midnight, January 1, 1970.

parameter.name: date
parameter.shortdesc: An integer from 1 to 31 indicating the day of the month.

method.name: setFullYear
method.shortdesc: Sets the year of a specified Date object according to local time.
method.description: This method can also set month and date if those arguments are specified. Returns the number of milliseconds between the new date and midnight, January 1, 1970.

parameter.name: year
parameter.shortdesc: A four-digit integer value indicating the year to set.

method.name: setHours
method.shortdesc: Sets the hours of a specified Date object according to local time.
method.description: Returns the number of milliseconds between the new date and midnight, January 1, 1970.

parameter.name: hour
parameter.shortdesc: An integer value from 0 (midnight) to 23 (11 PM).

method.name: setMilliseconds
method.shortdesc: Sets the milliseconds of a specified Date object according to local time.
method.description: Returns the number of milliseconds between the new date and midnight, January 1, 1970.

parameter.name: ms
parameter.shortdesc: An integer value from 0 to 999.

method.name: setMinutes
method.shortdesc: Sets the minutes of a specified Date object according to local time.
method.description: Returns the number of milliseconds between the new date and midnight, January 1, 1970.

parameter.name: minutes
parameter.shortdesc: An integer value from 0 to 59.

method.name: setSeconds
method.shortdesc: Sets the seconds of a specified Date object according to local time.
method.description: Returns the number of milliseconds between the new date and midnight, January 1, 1970.

parameter.name: seconds
parameter.shortdesc: An integer value from 0 to 59.

method.name: setMonth
method.shortdesc: Sets the month of a specified Date object according to local time.
method.description: Returns the number of milliseconds between the new date and midnight, January 1, 1970.

parameter.name: month
parameter.shortdesc: An integer value from 0 (Jan) to 11 (Dec).

method.name: setUTCDate
method.shortdesc: Sets the date of a specified Date object according to universal time.
method.description: Returns the number of milliseconds between the new date and midnight, January 1, 1970 in UTC time.

parameter.name: date
parameter.shortdesc: An integer from 1 to 31 indicating the day of the month.

method.name: setUTCFullYear
method.shortdesc: Sets the year of a specified Date object according to UTC, can also set the month and date.
method.description: Returns the number of milliseconds between the date set and midnight, January 1, 1970, in UTC.

parameter.name: year
parameter.shortdesc: The year expressed in four digits.

method.name: setUTCHours
method.shortdesc: Sets the hours of a specified Date object according to UTC.
method.description: Returns the number of milliseconds between the date set and midnight, January 1, 1970, in UTC.

parameter.name: hours
parameter.shortdesc: An integer value from 0 (midnight) to 23 (11 PM) indicating the hour to be set.

method.name: setUTCMilliseconds
method.shortdesc: Sets the milliseconds of a specified Date object according to UTC.
method.description: Returns the number of milliseconds between the date set and midnight, January 1, 1970, in UTC.

parameter.name: ms
parameter.shortdesc: An integer value in the range of 0 to 999 indicating the number of milliseconds to set.

method.name: setUTCMinutes
method.shortdesc: Sets the minutes of a specified Date object according to UTC.
method.description: Returns the number of milliseconds between the date set and midnight, January 1, 1970, in UTC.

parameter.name: min
parameter.shortdesc: An integer value in the range 0 to 59 indicating the number of minutes to be set.

method.name: setUTCSeconds
method.shortdesc: Sets the seconds of a specified Date object according to UTC.
method.description: Returns the number of milliseconds between the date set and midnight, January 1, 1970, in UTC.

parameter.name: sec
parameter.shortdesc: An integer value in the range 0 to 59 indicating the number of seconds to set.

method.name: setUTCMonth
method.shortdesc: Sets the month of a specified Date object according to UTC.
method.description: Returns the number of milliseconds between the date set and midnight, January 1, 1970, in UTC.

parameter.name: month
parameter.shortdesc: An integer value in the range 0 (Jan.) to 11 (Dec.) indicating the month to set.

method.name: setTime
method.shortdesc: Sets the date of a specified Date object in milliseconds since midnight, January 1, 1970.
method.description: Returns the value of ms.

parameter.name: ms
parameter.shortdesc: An integer indicating the number of milliseconds between the date set and midnight, January 1, 1970.

method.name: setYear
method.shortdesc: Sets the year of a specified Date object according to local time, as a difference between the current year and 1900.
method.description: Returns the number of milliseconds between the date set and midnight, January 1, 1970.

parameter.name: year
parameter.shortdesc: An integer value indicating the year to set.
parameter.description: The method interprets a 1- or 2- digit value to mean the 1900s; for example, 13 is interpreted to mean 1913.

method.name: toDateString
method.description: Returns the date as a string.

method.name: toTimeString
method.description: Returns the time as a string.

method.name: toLocaleString
method.description: Returns a string value representing the date and time stored in the Date object in human readable format (localized).

method.name: toLocaleDateString
method.description: Returns the date as a localized string.

method.name: toLocaleTimeString
method.description: Returns the time as a localized string.

method.name: toGMTString
method.description: Returns the date and time adjusted to GMT (UTC) as a string.

method.name: toUTCString
method.description: Returns the date and time adjusted to UTC as a string.

method.name: toString
method.shortdesc: Returns a string value representing the date and time stored in the Date object in human readable format.
method.description: Returns the following string is an example of the format returned by this method: Mon Aug 13, 10:54:21 GMT-0700 2001.

method.name: valueOf
method.shortdesc: The valueOf() method returns the number of milliseconds that have passed since midnight, Returns an integer.

method.name: toSource
method.shortdesc: Creates a string representation of this object that can be fed back to eval() to re-create an object. Works only with built-in classes.

classdef.name: Function
classdef.shortdesc: Wraps a built-in or JavaScript function.

method.name: Function
method.description: The Function constructor parses the argument list and creates a Function object.

parameter.name: arguments
parameter.shortdesc: The list of formal arguments, separated by commas.
parameter.description: The formal arguments can also be supplied one by one; in this case, the last argument to the Function constructor is considered to be the function body.

parameter.name: body
parameter.shortdesc: The body of the function to create.

property.name: arguments
property.shortdesc: The function arguments, packed into an array.
property.description: This property is deprecated; use the arguments property within the function body.

property.name: length
property.shortdesc: The number of formal arguments.

property.name: arity
property.shortdesc: The number of formal arguments.
property.description: This property is deprecated; use the length property instead.

property.name: name
property.shortdesc: The function name.

method.name: apply
method.shortdesc: Apply a this object and an argument list to a function.
method.description: This function is different from call(); here, the arguments are suppliedas an Array object.

parameter.name: thisObj
parameter.description: The object to be used as this.

parameter.name: args
parameter.shortdesc: An array of arguments.

method.name: call
method.shortdesc: Apply a this object and arguments to a function.
method.description: This function is different from apply(); here, the arguments are supplied one by one.

parameter.name: thisObj
parameter.description: The object to be used as this.

parameter.name: argument
parameter.description: The first agument to the function. Add as many as needed.

method.name: toSource
method.shortdesc: Creates a string representation of this object that can be fed back to eval() to re-create an object. Works only with JavaScript functions.

method.name: toString
method.shortdesc: Returns the function definition as a string.

classdef.name: global
classdef.shortdesc: The global methods and properties for ExtendScript.

property.name: NaN
property.shortdesc: The NaN global property is a predefined variable with the value NaN (Not-a-Number), as specified by the IEEE-754 standard.

property.name: Infinity
property.shortdesc: The Infinity global property is a predefined variable with the value for infinity.

property.name: undefined
property.shortdesc: This global property is a predefined variable with the value for an undefined value.

method.name: encodeURI
method.shortdesc: Encodes a string after RFC2396.
method.description: Create an UTF-8 ASCII encoded version of this string. The string is converted into UTF-8. Every non-alphanumeric character is encoded as a percent escape character of the form %xx, where xx is the hex value of the character. After the conversion to UTF-8 encoding and escaping, it is guaranteed that the string does not contain characters codes greater than 127. The list of characters not to be encoded is -_.!~*'();/?:@&=+$,#. The method returns false on errors.

parameter.name: text
parameter.shortdesc: The text to encode.

method.name: encodeURIComponent
method.shortdesc: Encodes a string after RFC2396.
method.description: Create an UTF-8 ASCII encoded version of this string. The string is converted into UTF-8. Every non-alphanumeric character is encoded as a percent escape character of the form %xx, where xx is the hex value of the character. After the conversion to UTF-8 encoding and escaping, it is guaranteed that the string does not contain characters codes greater than 127. The list of characters not to be encoded is -_.!~*'(). The method returns false on errors.

parameter.name: text
parameter.shortdesc: The text to encode.

method.name: decodeURI
method.shortdesc: Decodes a string created with encodeURI().

parameter.name: uri
parameter.shortdesc: The text to decode.

method.name: decodeURIComponent
method.shortdesc: Decodes a string created with encodeURIComponent().

parameter.name: uri
parameter.shortdesc: The text to decode.

method.name: escape
method.shortdesc: Creates a URL-encoded string from aString.
method.description: In the new string, characters of aString that require URL encoding are replaced with the format %xx, where xx is the hexadecimal value of the character code in the Unicode character set. This format is used to transmit information appended to a URL during, for example, execution of the GET method. Use the unescape() global function to translate the string back into its original format. Returns a string which is aString URL-encoded.

parameter.name: aString
parameter.shortdesc: The string to be encoded.

method.name: eval
method.shortdesc: Evaluates its argument as a JavaScript script, and returns the result of evaluation.
method.description: You can pass the result of an object's toSource() method to reconstruct that object.

parameter.name: stringExpression
parameter.shortdesc: The string to evaluate.

method.name: uneval
method.shortdesc: Creates a source code representation of the supplied argument, and returns it as a string.

parameter.name: what
parameter.shortdesc: The object to uneval.

method.name: isFinite
method.shortdesc: Evaluates an expression and reports whether the result is a finite number.
method.description: Returns true if the expression is a finite number, false otherwise. False if the value is infinity or negative infinity.

parameter.name: expression
parameter.shortdesc: Any valid JavaScript expression.

method.name: isNaN
method.shortdesc: Evaluates an expression and reports whether the result is "Not-a-Number" (NaN).
method.description: Returns true if the result of evaluation is not a number (NaN), false if the value is a number.

parameter.name: expression
parameter.shortdesc: Any valid JavaScript expression.

method.name: parseInt
method.shortdesc: Extracts an integer from a string.
method.description: Parses a string to find the first set of characters, in a specified base, that can be converted to an integer, and returns that integer, or NaN if it does not encounter characters that it can convert to a number.

parameter.name: text
parameter.shortdesc: The string from which to extract an integer.

parameter.name: base
parameter.shortdesc: The base of the string to parse (from base 2 to base 36).
parameter.description: If not supplied, base is determined by the format of string.

method.name: parseFloat
method.shortdesc: Extracts a floating-point number from a string.
method.description: Parses a string to find the first set of characters that can be converted to a floating point number, and returns that number, or NaN if it does not encounter characters that it can converted to a number. The function supports exponential notation.

parameter.name: text
parameter.shortdesc: The string from which to extract a floating point number.

method.name: unescape
method.shortdesc: Translates URL-encoded string into a regular string, and returns that string.
method.description: Use the escape() global function to URL-encode strings.

parameter.name: stringExpression
parameter.shortdesc: The URL-encoded string to convert.

method.name: localize
method.shortdesc: Localizes a ZString-encoded string and merges additional arguments into the string.

parameter.name: what
parameter.shortdesc: The string to localize. A ZString-encoded string that can contain placeholder for additional arguments in the form %1 to %n.

parameter.name: argument
parameter.shortdesc: Optional argument(s) to be merged into the string. There may be more than one argument.

method.name: isXMLName
method.shortdesc: Returns true if the supplied string is a valid XML name.

parameter.name: name
parameter.shortdesc: The XML name to test.

method.name: setDefaultXMLNamespace
method.shortdesc: Defines the default XML namespace.
method.description: This is a replacement function for the standard JavaScript statement set default xml namespace.

parameter.name: namespace
parameter.shortdesc: The namespace to use.
parameter.description: Omit this parameter to return to the empty namespace. This is either a Namespace object or a string.

method.name: alert
method.shortdesc: Displays an alert box

parameter.name: message
parameter.shortdesc: The text to display

parameter.name: title
parameter.shortdesc: The title of the alert; ignored on the Macintosh

parameter.name: errorIcon
parameter.shortdesc: Display an Error icon; ignored on the Macintosh

method.name: confirm
method.shortdesc: Displays an alert box with Yes and No buttons; returns true for Yes

parameter.name: message
parameter.shortdesc: The text to display

parameter.name: noAsDefault
parameter.shortdesc: Set to true to set the No button as the default button

parameter.name: title
parameter.shortdesc: The title of the alert; ignored on the Macintosh

method.name: prompt
method.shortdesc: Displays a dialog allowing the user to enter text
method.description: Returns null if the user cancelled the dialog, the text otherwise

parameter.name: prompt
parameter.shortdesc: The text to display

parameter.name: default
parameter.shortdesc: The default text to preset the edit field with

parameter.name: title
parameter.shortdesc: The title of the dialog;

classdef.name: String
classdef.shortdesc: A character string. Each character is adressable by index.

method.name: String
method.shortdesc: Returns a string representation of the value given as an argument.

parameter.name: value
parameter.shortdesc: A number, variable, or object to convert to a string.

method.name: fromCharCode
method.shortdesc: Returns a string created by concatenation one or more characters specified as ASCII values.

parameter.name: value1
parameter.shortdesc: One or more ASCII values.

property.name: length
property.shortdesc: The length of the string.

method.name: toString
method.shortdesc: Returns itself.

method.name: toSource
method.shortdesc: Creates a string representation of this object that can be fed back to eval() to re-create an object. Works only with built-in classes.

method.name: valueOf
method.shortdesc: Returns itself.

method.name: charAt
method.shortdesc: Returns the character at the specified index.

parameter.name: index
parameter.shortdesc: An integer between 0 and string.length -1, specifying the character to return.

method.name: charCodeAt
method.shortdesc: Returns the Unicode value of the character at the given index.

parameter.name: index
parameter.shortdesc: An integer between 0 and string.length -1, specifying the character.

method.name: concat
method.shortdesc: If necessary, converts the one or more given values to strings.
method.description: Those values are concatenated with the original string, the result is returned. The original string is not effected. Returns the concatenated string.

parameter.name: value
parameter.shortdesc: The values to be concatenated with the given string.

method.name: indexOf
method.shortdesc: Returns the index within the string of the first occurrence of the specified string, starting the search at fromIndex if provided.

parameter.name: searchValue
parameter.shortdesc: The string for which to search.

parameter.name: offset
parameter.shortdesc: The starting offset of the search.

method.name: lastIndexOf
method.shortdesc: Returns the index within the string of the last occurrence of the specified value.
method.description: The string is searched backward, starting at fromIndex. Returns the index within the string where the last occurrence of searchValue was found, or -1 if it was not found.

parameter.name: searchValue
parameter.shortdesc: The string for which to search.

parameter.name: offset
parameter.shortdesc: The starting offset of the search.

method.name: slice
method.shortdesc: Extracts a substring of the given string and returns it as a new string.
method.description: The substring begins at startSlice, and includes all characters up to, but not including the character at the index endSlice. A negative value indexes from the end of the string. For example, a negative value for startSlice is resolved as: string. length + startSlice. The original string is unchanged. Returns a substring of characters from the given string, starting at startSlice and ending with endSlice-1.

parameter.name: startSlice
parameter.shortdesc: The index at which to begin extraction.

parameter.name: endSlice
parameter.shortdesc: The index at which to end extraction.
parameter.description: If omitted, slice extracts to the end of the string.

method.name: toLowerCase
method.shortdesc: Returns a new string which contains all the characters of the original string converted to lowercase.
method.description: The original string is unchanged.

method.name: toUpperCase
method.shortdesc: Returns a new string which contains all the characters of the original string converted to uppercase.
method.description: The original string is unchanged.

method.name: toLocaleLowerCase
method.shortdesc: Returns a new string which contains all the characters of the original string converted to lowercase (localized).
method.description: The original string is unchanged.

method.name: toLocaleUpperCase
method.shortdesc: Returns a new string which contains all the characters of the original string converted to uppercase (localized).
method.description: The original string is unchanged.

method.name: localeCompare
method.shortdesc: Performs a localized comparison of two strings.

parameter.name: what
parameter.shortdesc: The string to compare with.

method.name: match
method.shortdesc: Matches a string against a regular expression.

parameter.name: regexp
parameter.shortdesc: The regular expression to use.

method.name: split
method.shortdesc: Splits a string into a group of substrings, places those strings in an array, and returns the array.
method.description: The substrings are created by breaking the original string at places that match delimiter, the delimiter characters are removed. Returns an array whose elements are the substrings.

parameter.name: delimiter
parameter.shortdesc: Specifies the string to use for delimiting.
parameter.description: If delimiter is omitted, the array returned contains one element, consisting of the entire string.

method.name: substr
method.shortdesc: Returns a string containing the characters beginning at the specified index, start, through the specified number of characters.
method.description: The original string is unchanged. Returns a string containing the extracted characters.

parameter.name: start
parameter.shortdesc: Location at which to begin extracting characters.

parameter.name: length
parameter.shortdesc: (OptIonal) The number of characters to extract.

method.name: substring
method.shortdesc: Returns a substring of the given string by extracting characters from indexA up to but not including indexB.
method.description: The original string is unchanged. Returns a substring of characters from the given string, starting at indexA and ending with indexB-1.

parameter.name: indexA
parameter.shortdesc: The index to begin extracting.

parameter.name: indexB
parameter.shortdesc: (Optional) The index at which to end extraction.
parameter.description: If omitted, slice extracts to the end of the string.

method.name: anchor
method.shortdesc: Returns a string consisting of this string enclosed in a <a> tag.

parameter.name: name
parameter.shortdesc: The text to be stored in the anchors' name attribute.

method.name: big
method.shortdesc: Returns a string consisting of this string enclosed in a <big> tag.

method.name: blink
method.shortdesc: Returns a string consisting of this string enclosed in a <blink> tag.

method.name: bold
method.shortdesc: Returns a string consisting of this string enclosed in a <b> tag.

method.name: fixed
method.shortdesc: Returns a string consisting of this string enclosed in a <tt> tag.

method.name: fontcolor
method.shortdesc: Returns a string consisting of this string enclosed in a <font> tag.

parameter.name: color
parameter.shortdesc: The value to be stored in the tag's color attribute.

method.name: fontsize
method.shortdesc: Returns a string consisting of this string enclosed in a <font> tag.

parameter.name: size
parameter.shortdesc: The value to be stored in the tag's size attribute.

method.name: italics
method.shortdesc: Returns a string consisting of this string enclosed in a <i> tag.

method.name: link
method.shortdesc: Returns a string consisting of this string enclosed in a <a> tag.

parameter.name: href
parameter.shortdesc: The value to be stored in the tag's href attribute.

method.name: small
method.shortdesc: Returns a string consisting of this string enclosed in a <small> tag.

method.name: strike
method.shortdesc: Returns a string consisting of this string enclosed in a <strike> tag.

method.name: sub
method.shortdesc: Returns a string consisting of this string enclosed in a <sub> tag.

method.name: sup
method.shortdesc: Returns a string consisting of this string enclosed in a <sup> tag.

classdef.name: Number
classdef.shortdesc: Wraps a numeric value.

method.name: Number
method.shortdesc: Returns a new Number object set to the value of the argument converted to a number.

parameter.name: value
parameter.shortdesc: The value of the object being created.

property.name: MIN_VALUE
property.shortdesc: A constant representing the smallest representable number.

property.name: MAX_VALUE
property.shortdesc: A constant representing the largest representable number.

property.name: NaN
property.shortdesc: A constant representing the special "Not a Number" value.

property.name: NEGATIVE_INFINITY
property.shortdesc: A constant representing negative infinity.

property.name: POSITIVE_INFINITY
property.shortdesc: A constant representing positive infinity.

method.name: toSource
method.shortdesc: Creates a string representation of this object that can be fed back to eval() to re-create an object. Works only with built-in classes.

method.name: toString
method.shortdesc: Returns the value of a Number object converted to a string.

parameter.name: radix
parameter.shortdesc: The optional conversion radix.

method.name: toLocaleString
method.shortdesc: Returns the value of a Number object converted to a string, using localized conventions.

method.name: toFixed
method.shortdesc: Converts the Number object to a string with fixed decimals.

parameter.name: decimals
parameter.shortdesc: The number of decimals.

method.name: toExponential
method.shortdesc: Converts the Number object to a string in scientific notation.

parameter.name: decimals
parameter.shortdesc: The number of decimals.

method.name: toPrecision
method.shortdesc: Converts the Number object to a string in either scientific or fixed notation, epending on its value.

parameter.name: decimals
parameter.shortdesc: The number of decimals.

method.name: valueOf
method.shortdesc: Returns the value of a Number object as a primitive number.

classdef.name: Boolean
classdef.shortdesc: Wraps a Boolean value.

method.name: Boolean
method.shortdesc: Creates and returns a new Boolean object set to the value of the argument converted to a boolean.

parameter.name: value
parameter.shortdesc: The value to be converted to a Boolean.

method.name: toSource
method.shortdesc: Creates a string representation of this object that can be fed back to eval() to re-create an object. Works only with built-in classes.

method.name: toString
method.shortdesc: Returns the string representation of the value of bool.
method.description: The method returns the string true if the primitive value of bool is true; otherwise it returns the string false.

method.name: valueOf
method.shortdesc: Returns the primitive value of bool.
method.description: The method returns true if the primitive value of bool is true; otherwise it returns false.

classdef.name: RegExp
classdef.shortdesc: Wraps a regular expression.

method.name: RegExp
method.shortdesc: Creates and returns a new RegExp object set to the value of the argument converted to a regular expression.

parameter.name: pattern
parameter.shortdesc: The pattern to convert.

parameter.name: flags
parameter.shortdesc: Flags that control how the conversion is performed.
parameter.description:
A string containing any combination of the letters i, m, g:
"i" -- ignore case in pattern matching
"m" -- treat the string as multiple lines
"g" -- do global pattern matching

property.shortdesc: The matched subexpression #1.
The matched subexpression #2.
The matched subexpression #3.
The matched subexpression #4.
The matched subexpression #5.
The matched subexpression #6.
The matched subexpression #7.
The matched subexpression #8.
The matched subexpression #9.

property.name: lastMatch
property.shortdesc: The last match.

property.name: lastParen
property.shortdesc: The value of the last matched subexpression.

property.name: leftContext
property.shortdesc: The string before the match.

property.name: rightContext
property.shortdesc: The string after the match.

property.name: global
property.shortdesc: Indicates whether the match is a global match.

property.name: ignoreCase
property.shortdesc: Indicates whether the match is not case sensitive.

property.name: multiline
property.shortdesc: Indicates whether the match matches multiple lines.

property.name: input
property.shortdesc: The original input string.

method.name: toString
method.shortdesc: Converts this RegExp object to a string.

method.name: compile
method.shortdesc: Compiles a string to a regular expression. Returns true if the compilation was successful.

parameter.name: pattern
parameter.shortdesc: The pattern to compile.

method.name: exec
method.shortdesc: Execute a regular expression.
method.description: The return value is an array of matches, with the first element containing the match, and successive elements containing the results of any matching subexpression in their order of appearance. If there is no match, the result is null.

parameter.name: text
parameter.shortdesc: The string to match.

method.name: test
method.shortdesc: Execute a regular expression, and return true if there is a match.

parameter.name: text
parameter.shortdesc: The string to match.

classdef.name: Error
classdef.shortdesc: Wraps a runtime error.

method.name: Error
method.shortdesc: Creates a new Error object.

parameter.name: msg
parameter.shortdesc: The error message.

parameter.name: file
parameter.shortdesc: The name of the file.

parameter.name: line
parameter.shortdesc: The line number.

property.name: description
property.shortdesc: The error message.

method.name: toString
method.shortdesc: Convert this object to a string.

method.name: toSource
method.shortdesc: Creates a string representation of this object that can be fed back to eval() to re-create an object. Works only with built-in classes.

classdef.name: File
classdef.shortdesc: Represents a file in the local file system in a platform-independent manner.

method.name: File
method.shortdesc: Creates and returns a new File object referring to a given file system location.

parameter.name: path
parameter.shortdesc: The full or partial path name of the file, in platform-specific or URI format.
parameter.description:
The value stored in the object is the absolute path. The file that the path refers to does not need to exist.If the path refers to an existing folder:
The File function returns a Folder object instead of a File object.
The new operator returns a File object for a nonexisting file with the same name.

property.name: fs
property.shortdesc: The name of the file system.
property.description: This is a class property accessed through the File constructor. Valid values are "Windows", "Macintosh", and "Unix".

method.name: encode
method.shortdesc: Encodes a string as required by RFC 2396, and returns the encoded string.
method.description:
All special characters are encoded in UTF-8 and stored as escaped characters starting with the percent sign followed by two hexadecimal digits. For example, the string "my file" is encoded as "my%20file".
Special characters are those with a numeric value greater than 127, except the following: / - _ . ! ~ * ' ( )
See also encodeURI().

parameter.name: name
parameter.shortdesc: The string to encode.

method.name: decode
method.shortdesc: Decodes a UTF-8 encoded string as required by RFC 2396, and returns the decoded string.
method.description: See also String.decodeURI().

parameter.name: uri
parameter.shortdesc: The UTF-8 encoded string to decode.

method.name: isEncodingAvailable
method.shortdesc: Reports whether a given encoding is available.

parameter.name: name
parameter.shortdesc: The encoding name.
parameter.description: Typical values are "ASCII", "binary", or "UTF-8". For a complete list of supported encodings, see the JavaScript Tools Guide.

method.name: openDialog
method.shortdesc: Opens a dialog so the user can select one or more files to open.
method.description:
Opens the built-in platform-specific file-browsing dialog in which a user can select an existing file or multiple files, and creates new File objects to represent the selected files.
If the user clicks OK, returns a File object for the selected file, or an array of objects if multiple files are selected.
If the user cancels, returns null.

parameter.name: prompt
parameter.shortdesc: The prompt text, displayed if the dialog allows a prompt.

parameter.name: filter
parameter.shortdesc: A filter that limits the types of files displayed in the dialog.

description.li: In Windows, a filter expression such as "Javascript files:*.jsx;All files:*.*".
In Mac OS, a filter function that takes a File instance and returns true if the file should be included in the display, false if it should not.

parameter.name: multiSelect
parameter.shortdesc: When true, the user can select multiple files and the return value is an array.

method.name: saveDialog
method.shortdesc: Opens a dialog so the user can select a file name to save to.
method.description:
Opens the built-in platform-specific file-browsing dialog in which a user can select an existing file location to which to save information, and creates a new File object to represent the selected file location.
If the user clicks OK, returns a File object for the selected file location.
If the user cancels, returns null.

parameter.name: prompt
parameter.shortdesc: The prompt text, displayed if the dialog allows a prompt.

parameter.name: filter
parameter.shortdesc: In Windows only, a filter that limits the types of files displayed in the dialog.
parameter.description: In Windows only, a filter expression such as "Javascript files:*.jsx;All files:*.*". Not used In Mac OS.

property.name: alias
property.shortdesc: If true, the object refers to a file system alias or shortcut.

property.name: created
property.shortdesc: The creation date of the referenced file, or null if the object does not refer to a file on disk.

property.name: error
property.shortdesc: A string containing a message describing the most recent file system error.
property.description: Typically set by the file system, but a script can set it. Setting this value clears any error message and resets the error bit for opened files. Contains the empty string if there is no error.

property.name: exists
property.shortdesc: If true, this object refers to a file or file-system alias that actually exists in the file system.

property.name: fsName
property.shortdesc: The platform-specific full path name for the referenced file.

property.name: fullName
property.shortdesc: The full path name for the referenced file in URI notation.

property.name: absoluteURI
property.shortdesc: The full path name for the referenced file in URI notation.

property.name: relativeURI
property.shortdesc: The path name for the object in URI notation, relative to the current folder.

property.name: modified
property.shortdesc: The date of the referenced file's last modification, or null if the object does not refer to a file on the disk.

property.name: name
property.shortdesc: The file name portion of the absolute URI for the referenced file, without the path specification.

property.name: displayName
property.shortdesc: The localized name of the referenced file, without the path specification.

property.name: path
property.shortdesc: The path portion of the absolute URI for the referenced file, without the file name.

property.name: parent
property.shortdesc: The Folder object for the folder that contains this file.

property.name: type
property.shortdesc: The file type as a four-character string.

description.li: In Mac OS, the Mac OS file type.
In Windows, "appl" for .EXE files, "shlb" for .DLL files and "TEXT" for any other file.

property.name: creator
property.shortdesc: In Mac OS, the file creator as a four-character string. In Windows or UNIX, value is "????".

property.name: hidden
property.shortdesc: When true, the file is not shown in the platform-specific file browser.
property.description: If the object references a file-system alias or shortcut, the flag is altered on the alias, not on the original file.

property.name: readonly
property.shortdesc: When true, prevents the file from being altered or deleted.
property.description: If the referenced file is a file-system alias or shortcut, the flag is altered on the alias, not on the original file.

property.name: lineFeed
property.shortdesc: How line feed characters are written in the file system.
property.description: One of the values "Windows", "Macintosh", or "Unix".

property.name: length
property.shortdesc: The size of the file in bytes.
property.description: Can be set only for a file that is not open, in which case it truncates or pads the file with 0-bytes to the new length.

property.name: encoding
property.shortdesc: Gets or sets the encoding for subsequent read/write operations.
property.description:
One of the encoding constants listed in the JavaScript Tools Guide. If the value is not recognized, uses the system default encoding.
A special encoder, BINARY, is used to read binary files. It stores each byte of the file as one Unicode character regardless of any encoding. When writing, the lower byte of each Unicode character is treated as a single byte to write.

property.name: eof
property.shortdesc: When true, a read attempt caused the current position to be at the end of the file, or the file is not open.

method.name: resolve
method.shortdesc: Attempts to resolve the file-system alias or shortcut that this object refers to.
method.description: If successful, creates and returns a new File object that points to the resolved file system element. Returns null if this object does not refer to an alias, or if the alias could not be resolved.

method.name: rename
method.shortdesc: Renames the associated file.
method.description: Does not resolve aliases, but renames the referenced alias or shortcut file itself. Returns true if the file was successfully renamed.

parameter.name: newName
parameter.shortdesc: The new file name, with no path information.

method.name: remove
method.shortdesc: Deletes the file associated with this object from disk immediately, without moving it to the system trash.
method.description:
Does not resolve aliases; instead, deletes the referenced alias or shortcut file itself. Returns true if the file was successfully removed.
IMPORTANT: Cannot be undone. It is recommended that you prompt the user for permission before deleting.

method.name: changePath
method.shortdesc: Changes the path specification of the referenced file.

parameter.name: path
parameter.shortdesc: A string containing the new path, absolute or relative to the current folder.

method.name: getRelativeURI
method.shortdesc: Retrieves and returns the path for this file, relative to the specified base path, in URI notation.
method.description: If no base path is supplied, the URI is relative to the path of the current folder. Returns a string containing the relative URI.

parameter.name: basePath
parameter.shortdesc: A base path in URI notation.

method.name: execute
method.shortdesc: Executes or opens this file using the appropriate application, as if it had been double-clicked in a file browser.
method.description:
You can use this method to run scripts, launch applications, and so on.
Returns true immediately if the application launch was successful.

method.name: openDlg
method.shortdesc: Opens the built-in platform-specific file-browsing dialog, in which the user can select an existing file or files, and creates new File objects to represent the selected files.
method.description:
Differs from the class method openDialog() in that it presets the current folder to this File objects parent folder and the current file to this objects associated file.
If the user clicks OK, returns a File or Folder object for the selected file or folder, or an array of objects.
If the user cancels, returns null.

parameter.name: prompt
parameter.shortdesc: A string containing the prompt text, if the dialog allows a prompt.

parameter.name: filter
parameter.shortdesc: A filter that limits the types of files displayed in the dialog.

description.li: In Windows, a filter expression such as "Javascript files:*.jsx;All files:*.*".
In Mac OS, a filter function that takes a File instance and returns true if the file should be included in the display, false if it should not.

parameter.name: multiSelect
parameter.shortdesc: When true, the user can select multiple files and the return value is an array.

method.name: saveDlg
method.shortdesc: Opens the built-in platform-specific file-browsing dialog, in which the user can select an existing file location to which to save information, and creates a new File object to represent the selected file.
method.description:
Differs from the class method saveDialog() in that it presets the current folder to this File objects parent folder and the file to this objects associated file.
If the user clicks OK, returns a File object for the selected file.
If the user cancels, returns null.

parameter.name: prompt
parameter.shortdesc: A string containing the prompt text, if the dialog allows a prompt.

parameter.name: filter
parameter.shortdesc: In Windows only, a filter that limits the types of files displayed in the dialog.
parameter.description: In Windows only, a filter expression such as "Javascript files:*.jsx;All files:*.*". Not used In Mac OS.

method.name: toString
method.shortdesc: Converts this object to a string.

method.name: toSource
method.shortdesc: Creates and returns a serialized string representation of this object.
method.description: Pass the resulting string to eval() to recreate the object.

method.name: createAlias
method.shortdesc: Makes this file a file-system alias or shortcut to the specified file.
method.description: The referenced file for this object must not yet exist on disk. Returns true if the operation was successful.

parameter.name: path
parameter.shortdesc: A string containing the path of the target file.

method.name: open
method.shortdesc: Opens the referenced file for subsequent read/write operations. The method resolves any aliases to find the file.
method.description:
Returns true if the file was opened successfully.
The method attempts to detect the encoding of the open file. It reads a few bytes at the current location and tries to detect the Byte Order Mark character 0xFFFE. If found, the current position is advanced behind the detected character and the encoding property is set to one of the strings UCS-2BE, UCS-2LE, UCS4-BE, UCS-4LE, or UTF-8. If the marker character is not found, it checks for zero bytes at the current location and makes an assumption about one of the above formats (except UTF-8). If everything fails, the encoding property is set to the system encoding.
IMPORTANT: Be careful about opening a file more than once. The operating system usually permits you to do so, but if you start writing to the file using two different File objects, you can destroy your data.

parameter.name: mode
parameter.shortdesc: The read-write mode, a single-character string.
parameter.description:
One of these characters:
r (read) Opens for reading. If the file does not exist or cannot be found, the call fails.
w (write) Opens a file for writing. If the file exists, its contents are destroyed. If the file does not exist, creates a new, empty file.
e (edit) Opens an existing file for reading and writing.
a (append) Opens an existing file for reading and writing, and moves the current position to the end of the file.

parameter.name: type
parameter.shortdesc: In Mac OS, the type of a newly created file, a 4-character string. Ignored in Windows and UNIX.

parameter.name: creator
parameter.shortdesc: In Mac OS, the creator of a newly created file, a 4-character string. Ignored in Windows and UNIX.

method.name: close
method.shortdesc: Closes this open file.
method.description: Returns true if the file was closed successfully, false if an I/O error occurred.

method.name: read
method.shortdesc: Reads the contents of the file, starting at the current position.
method.description: Returns a string that contains up to the specified number of characters. If a number of characters is not supplied, reads from the current position to the end of the file. If the file is encoded, multiple bytes might be read to create single Unicode characters.

parameter.name: chars
parameter.shortdesc: An integer specifying the number of characters to read.

method.name: readch
method.shortdesc: Reads a single text character from the file at the current position.
method.description: Line feeds are recognized as CR, LF, CRLF or LFCR pairs. If the file is encoded, multiple bytes might be read to create a single Unicode character. Returns a string that contains the character.

method.name: readln
method.shortdesc: Reads a single line of text from the file at the current position.
method.description: Line feeds are recognized as CR, LF, CRLF or LFCR pairs.. If the file is encoded, multiple bytes might be read to create single Unicode characters. Returns a string that contains the text.

method.name: write
method.shortdesc: Writes the specified text to the file at the current position.
method.description:
You can supply multiple text values; the strings are concatenated to form a single string.
For encoded files, writing a single Unicode character may write multiple bytes. Returns true if the write was successful.
IMPORTANT: Be careful not to write to a file that is open in another application or object, as this can overwrite existing data.

parameter.name: text
parameter.shortdesc: A text string to be written.

method.name: writeln
method.shortdesc: Writes a string to the file at the current position and appends a line-feed sequence.
method.description:
You can supply multiple text values. The strings are concatenated into a single string, which is written in the file followed by one line-feed sequence, of the style specified by this object's linefeed property.
For encoded files, writing a single Unicode character may write multiple bytes. Returns true if the write was successful.
IMPORTANT: Be careful not to write to a file that is open in another application or object, as this can overwrite existing data.

parameter.name: text
parameter.shortdesc: A text string to be written.

method.name: seek
method.shortdesc: Seeks to a given position in the file.
method.description: The new position cannot be less than 0 or greater than the current file size. Returns true if the position was changed.

parameter.name: pos
parameter.shortdesc: The new current position in the file as an offset in bytes from the start, current position, or end, depending on the mode.

parameter.name: mode
parameter.shortdesc: The seek mode.
parameter.description:
One of:
0: Seek to absolute position, where pos=0 is the first byte of the file. This is the default.
1: Seek relative to the current position.
2. Seek backward from the end of the file.

method.name: tell
method.shortdesc: Retrieves the current position as a byte offset from the start of the file.
method.description: Returns a number, the position index.

method.name: copy
method.shortdesc: Copies this objects referenced file to the specified target location.
method.description: Resolves any aliases to find the source file. If a file exists at the target location, it is overwritten. Returns true if the copy was successful.

parameter.name: target
parameter.shortdesc: A string with the URI path to the target location, or a File object that references the target location.

classdef.name: Folder
classdef.shortdesc: Represents a file-system folder or directory in a platform-independent manner.

method.name: Folder
method.shortdesc: Creates and returns a new Folder object referring to a given file-system location.
method.description: If the path name refers to an already existing disk file, a File object is returned instead. Returns the new Folder object.

parameter.name: path
parameter.shortdesc: The absolute or relative path to the folder associated with this object, specified in URI format.
parameter.description:
The value stored in the object is the absolute path.The path need not refer to an existing folder. If the path refers to an existing file, rather than a folder:
The Folder() function returns a File object instead of a Folder object.
The new operator returns a Folder object for a nonexisting folder with the same name.

property.name: fs
property.shortdesc: The name of the current file system.
property.description: One of "Windows", "Macintosh", or "Unix".

property.name: current
property.shortdesc: A Folder object for the current folder.
property.description: Assign a Folder object or a string containing the new path name to set the current folder. This is a class property accessed through the Folder constructor.

property.name: startup
property.shortdesc: A Folder object for the folder containing the executable image of the running application.

property.name: appPackage
property.shortdesc: In Mac OS, a Folder object for the folder containing the bundle of the running application.

property.name: system
property.shortdesc: A Folder object for the folder containing the operating system files.

description.li: In Windows, the value of %windir% (by default, C:\\Windows)

property.name: trash
property.shortdesc: A Folder object for the folder containing deleted items. On Windows, the trash folder is a virtual folder containing a database; therefore, the property value is null on Windows.

property.name: temp
property.shortdesc: A Folder object for the default folder for temporary files.

property.name: userData
property.shortdesc: A Folder object for the folder containing the user's application data.

description.li: In Windows, the value of %USERDATA% (by default, C:\\Documents and Settings\\username\\Application Data)

property.name: appData
property.shortdesc: The folder containing the application data for all users.

description.li: In Windows, the value of %APPDATA% (by default, C:\\Documents and Settings\\All Users\\Application Data)

property.name: commonFiles
property.shortdesc: A Folder object for the folder containing common files for all programs installed by the user.

description.li: In Windows, the value of %CommonProgramFiles% (by default, C:\\Program Files\\Common Files)

property.name: myDocuments
property.shortdesc: A folder pointing to the user's My Documents folder.

description.li: In Windows, C:\\Documents and Settings\\username\\My Documents

property.name: desktop
property.shortdesc: A Folder object for the folder that contains the users desktop.

method.name: encode
method.shortdesc: Encodes a string as required by RFC 2396, and returns the encoded string.
method.description:
All special characters are encoded in UTF-8 and stored as escaped characters starting with the percent sign followed by two hexadecimal digits. For example, the string "my file" is encoded as "my%20file".
Special characters are those with a numeric value greater than 127, except the following: / - _ . ! ~ * ' ( )
See also encodeURI().

parameter.name: name
parameter.shortdesc: The string to encode.

method.name: decode
method.shortdesc: Decodes a UTF-8 encoded string as required by RFC 2396, and returns the decoded string.
method.description: See also String.decodeURI().

parameter.name: uri
parameter.shortdesc: The UTF-8 string to decode.

method.name: isEncodingAvailable
method.shortdesc: Reports whether a given encoding is available.

parameter.name: name
parameter.shortdesc: The encoding name.
parameter.description: Typical values are "ASCII", "binary", or "UTF-8". For a complete list of supported encodings, see the JavaScript Tools Guide.

method.name: selectDialog
method.shortdesc: Opens the built-in platform-specific file-browsing dialog, and creates a new File or Folder object for the selected file or folder.
method.description:
Differs from the object method selectDlg() in that it does not preselect a folder.
If the user clicks OK, returns a File or Folder object for the selected file or folder.
If the user cancels, returns null.

parameter.name: prompt
parameter.shortdesc: The prompt text, if the dialog allows a prompt.

property.name: alias
property.shortdesc: When true, the object refers to a file system alias or shortcut.

property.name: created
property.shortdesc: The creation date of the referenced folder, or null if the object does not refer to a folder on disk.

property.name: error
property.shortdesc: A message describing the most recent file system error.
property.description: Typically set by the file system, but a script can set it. Setting this value clears any error message and resets the error bit for opened files. Contains the empty string if there is no error.

property.name: exists
property.shortdesc: When true, this object refers to a folder that currently exists in the file system.

property.name: fsName
property.shortdesc: The platform-specific name of the referenced folder as a full path name.

property.name: fullName
property.shortdesc: The full path name for the referenced folder in URI notation. .

property.name: absoluteURI
property.shortdesc: The full path name for the referenced folder in URI notation.

property.name: relativeURI
property.shortdesc: The path name for the referenced folder in URI notation, relative to the current folder.

property.name: modified
property.shortdesc: The date of the referenced folder's last modification, or null if the object does not refer to a folder on disk.

property.name: name
property.shortdesc: The folder name portion of the absolute URI for the referenced file, without the path specification.

property.name: displayName
property.shortdesc: The localized name portion of the absolute URI for the referenced folder, without the path specification.

property.name: path
property.shortdesc: The path portion of the object absolute URI for the referenced file, without the folder name.

property.name: parent
property.shortdesc: TThe Folder object for the folder that contains this folder, or null if this object refers to the root folder of a volume.

method.name: resolve
method.shortdesc: Attempts to resolve the file-system alias or shortcut that this object refers to.
method.description: If successful, creates and returns a new Folder object that points to the resolved file system element. Returns null if this object does not refer to an alias, or if the alias could not be resolved.

method.name: rename
method.shortdesc: Renames the associated folder.
method.description: Does not resolve aliases, but renames the referenced alias or shortcut file itself. Returns true if the folder was successfully renamed.

parameter.name: newName
parameter.shortdesc: The new folder name, with no path information.

method.name: remove
method.shortdesc: Deletes the folder associated with this object from disk immediately, without moving it to the system trash.
method.description:
Folders must be empty before they can be deleted. Does not resolve aliases; instead, deletes the referenced alias or shortcut file itself. Returns true if the file was successfully removed.
IMPORTANT: Cannot be undone. It is recommended that you prompt the user for permission before deleting.

method.name: changePath
method.shortdesc: Changes the path specification of the referenced folder.

parameter.name: path
parameter.shortdesc: A string containing the new path, absolute or relative to the current folder.

method.name: getRelativeURI
method.shortdesc: Retrieves and returns the path for this file, relative to the specified base path, in URI notation.
method.description: If no base path is supplied, the URI is relative to the path of the current folder. Returns a string containing the relative URI.

parameter.name: basePath
parameter.shortdesc: A base path in URI notation.

method.name: execute
method.shortdesc: Opens this folder in the platform-specific file browser (as if it had been double-clicked in the file browser).
method.description: Returns true immediately if the folder was opened successfully.

method.name: toString
method.shortdesc: Converts this object to a string.

method.name: toSource
method.shortdesc: Creates and returns a serialized string representation of this object.
method.description: Pass the resulting string to eval() to recreate the object.

method.name: selectDlg
method.shortdesc: Opens the built-in platform-specific file-browsing dialog, and creates a new File or Folder object for the selected file or folder.
method.description:
Differs from the class method selectDialog() in that it preselects this folder.
If the user clicks OK, returns a File or Folder object for the selected file or folder.
If the user cancels, returns null.

parameter.name: prompt
parameter.shortdesc: The prompt text, if the dialog allows a prompt.

method.name: getFiles
