method.shortdesc: Retrieves the contents of this folder, filtered by the supplied mask.
method.description: Returns an array of File and Folder objects, or null if this object's referenced folder does not exist.

parameter.name: mask
parameter.shortdesc: A search mask for file names, specified as a string or a function.
parameter.description:
A mask string can contain question mark (?) and asterisk (*) wild cards. Default is "*", which matches all file names.
Can also be the name of a function that takes a File or Folder object as its argument. It is called for each file or folder found in the search; if it returns true, the object is added to the return array.
NOTE: In Windows, all aliases end with the extension .lnk. ExtendScript strips this from the file name when found, in order to preserve compatibility with other operating systems. You can search for all aliases by supplying the search mask "*.lnk", but note that such code is not portable.

method.name: create
method.shortdesc: Creates a folder at the location given by this object's path property.
method.description: Returns true if the folder was created.

classdef.name: Socket
classdef.shortdesc: Creates a TCP/IP connection, or establishes a TCP/IP server.

method.name: Socket
method.shortdesc: Creates a new Socket object.

property.name: host
property.shortdesc: The name of the remote computer when a connection is established.
property.description: If the connection is shut down or does not exist, the property contains the empty string.

property.name: encoding
property.shortdesc: Sets or retrieves the name of the encoding used to transmit data.
property.description: Typical values are "ASCII", "BINARY", or "UTF-8".

property.name: error
property.shortdesc: A message describing the most recent error. Setting this value clears any error message.

property.name: eof
property.shortdesc: When true, the receive buffer is empty.

property.name: connected
property.shortdesc: When true, the connection is active.

property.name: timeout
property.shortdesc: The timeout in seconds to be applied to read or write operations.

method.name: open
method.shortdesc: Opens the connection for subsequent read/write operations.
method.description: The call to open() and the call to listen() are mutually exclusive. Call one function or the other, not both.

parameter.name: host
parameter.shortdesc: The server to connect to.
parameter.description: This can be a DNS name, an IPv4 address, or an IPv6 address, followed by a colon and a port number.

parameter.name: encoding
parameter.shortdesc: The encoding to be used for the connection
parameter.description: Typical values are "ASCII", "binary", or "UTF-8".

method.name: listen
method.shortdesc: Instructs the object to start listening for an incoming connection.
method.description: The call to open() and the call to listen()are mutually exclusive. Call one function or the other, not both.

parameter.name: port
parameter.shortdesc: The TCP/IP port number to listen on.
parameter.description: Valid port numbers are 1 to 65535. Typical values are 80 for a Web server, 23 for a Telnet server and so on.

parameter.name: encoding
parameter.shortdesc: The encoding to be used for the connection
parameter.description: Typical values are "ASCII", "BINARY", or "UTF-8".

method.name: close
method.shortdesc: Terminates the open connection.
method.description:
Returns true if the connection was closed, false on I/O errors.
Deleting the object also closes the connection, but not until JavaScript garbage-collects the object. The connection might stay open longer than you wish if you do not close it explicitly.

method.name: read
method.shortdesc: Reads up to the specified number of characters from the connection. CR characters are ignored unless the encoding is set to "BINARY".
method.description: Returns a string that contains up to the number of characters that were supposed to be read, or the number of characters read before the connection closed or timed out.

parameter.name: count
parameter.shortdesc: The number of characters to read.
parameter.description: If not supplied, the connection attempts to read as many characters it can get and returns immediately.

method.name: readln
method.shortdesc: Reads one line of text up to the next line feed.
method.description: Line feeds are recognized as LF or CRLF pairs. CR characters are ignored. Returns a string containing the characters.

method.name: write
method.shortdesc: Concatenates all arguments into a single string and writes that string to the connection.

parameter.name: text
parameter.shortdesc: Any number of string values. All arguments are concatenated to form the string to be written. CRLF sequences are converted to LFs unless the encoding is set to "BINARY".

method.name: writeln
method.shortdesc: Concatenates all arguments into a single string, appends a LF character, and writes that string to the connection.

parameter.name: text
parameter.shortdesc: Any number of string values. All arguments are concatenated to form the string to be written. CRLF sequences are converted to LFs unless the encoding is set to "BINARY".

method.name: poll
method.shortdesc: Checks a listening object for a new incoming connection.
method.description: If a connection request was detected, the method returns a new Socket object that wraps the new connection. Use this connection object to communicate with the remote computer. After use, close the connection and delete the JavaScript object. If no new connection request was detected, the method returns null.

classdef.name: ReflectionInfo
classdef.shortdesc: Provides information about a method, a property or a method parameters.

property.name: parent
property.shortdesc: The class object that this element belongs to.

property.name: name
property.shortdesc: The element name.

property.name: type
property.shortdesc: The element type.
property.description: One of unknown, readonly, readwrite, createonly, method or parameter.

property.name: dataType
property.shortdesc: The data type.

property.name: arguments
property.shortdesc: The description of method or function arguments.

property.name: min
property.shortdesc: The minimum value.

property.name: max
property.shortdesc: The maximum value.

property.name: defaultValue
property.shortdesc: The default value.

property.name: isCollection
property.shortdesc: Contains true if the class describes a collection class.

property.name: description
property.shortdesc: The long description text.

property.name: help
property.shortdesc: The short description text.

property.name: sampleCode
property.shortdesc: Sample code, if present.

property.name: sampleFile
property.shortdesc: A file containing sample code. May be null.

classdef.name: Reflection
classdef.shortdesc: Provides information about a class.

property.name: name
property.shortdesc: The class name.

property.name: methods
property.shortdesc: An array of method descriptions.

property.name: properties
property.shortdesc: An array of property descriptions.

property.name: staticMethods
property.shortdesc: An array of class method descriptions.

property.name: staticProperties
property.shortdesc: An array of class property descriptions.

property.name: description
property.shortdesc: The long description text.

property.name: help
property.shortdesc: The short description text.

property.name: sampleCode
property.shortdesc: Sample code, if present.

property.name: sampleFile
property.shortdesc: A file containing sample code. May be null.

method.name: find
method.shortdesc: Finds an element description by name.

parameter.name: name
parameter.shortdesc: The name of the element to find.

method.name: toXML
method.shortdesc: Returns this class information as XML in OMV format.

classdef.name: QName
classdef.shortdesc: A qualified XML name, containing the URI and the local name.

method.name: QName
method.shortdesc: Creates a QName object.

parameter.name: uri
parameter.shortdesc: The URI, specified as a Namespace object, an existing QName object, or string.

u.li: If this is a Namespace object, the URI is set to the namespace URI, and there is no local name.
If this is a QName object, the URI and localName is set to those of that object.
If this is a string, the URI is set to that string.

parameter.name: name
parameter.shortdesc: The local name. Used only if URI is given as a string.

property.name: uri
property.shortdesc: The URI part of the qualified name.

property.name: localName
property.shortdesc: The local name part of the qualified name.

classdef.name: Namespace
classdef.shortdesc: A XML namespace object.

method.name: Namespace
method.shortdesc: Creates a Namespace object.

parameter.name: prefix
parameter.shortdesc: The URI prefix, specified as an existing Namespace object, QName object, or string.

u.li: If this is a Namespace or a QName object, the URI and prefix are set to that of the object.
If this is a string, the prefix is set to that string, and the URI must be specified.

parameter.name: uri
parameter.shortdesc: The URI if the prefix is specified as a string.

property.name: prefix
property.shortdesc: The named prefix.

property.name: uri
property.shortdesc: The URI.

classdef.name: XML
classdef.shortdesc: Wraps XML into an object.

method.name: XML
method.shortdesc: Parses an XML string. Throws an error if the XML is incorrect.

parameter.name: text
parameter.shortdesc: The text to parse.

property.name: ignoreComments
property.shortdesc: Controls whether XML comments should be parsed (false) or ignored (true).

property.name: ignoreProcessingInstructions
property.shortdesc: Controls whether XML preprocessing instructions should be parsed (false) or ignored (true).

property.name: ignoreWhitespace
property.shortdesc: Controls whether whitespace should be parsed (false) or ignored (true).

property.name: prettyPrinting
property.shortdesc: When true, XML is pretty-printed when converting to a string.

property.name: prettyIndent
property.shortdesc: The number of spaces used to indent pretty-printed XML.

method.name: settings
method.shortdesc: Returns an object containing the current parsing and print settings for XML.

method.name: setSettings
method.shortdesc: Sets the parsing and print setting for XML using an object returned by the settings() method.

parameter.name: obj
parameter.shortdesc: The object containing the settings to set.

method.name: defaultSettings
method.shortdesc: Returns an object containing the default parsing and print settings for XML.

method.name: addNamespace
method.shortdesc: Adds a namespace declaration to the node. Returns the XML object itself.

parameter.name: namespace
parameter.shortdesc: The namespace to add.

method.name: appendChild
method.shortdesc: Appends the given XML to this XML as a child. Returns the XML object itself.
method.description: If the argument is not XML, creates a new XML element containing the argument as text. The element name of that new XML is the same as the last element in the original XML.

parameter.name: child
parameter.shortdesc: The child XML to add.

method.name: attribute
method.shortdesc: Returns a list containing all attribute elements matching the given name.

parameter.name: name
parameter.shortdesc: The attribute name to look for.

method.name: attributes
method.shortdesc: Returns a list containing all attribute elements.

method.name: child
method.shortdesc: Returns a list containing all children of this XML matching the given element name.
method.description: If the argument is a number, uses the number as index into the array of children.

parameter.name: name
parameter.shortdesc: The name or the index of the child element.

method.name: childIndex
method.shortdesc: Returns a number representing the ordinal position of this XML object within the context of its parent.

method.name: children
method.shortdesc: Returns an XML object containing all the properties of this XML object in order.

method.name: comments
method.shortdesc: Returns an XML object containing the properties of this XML object that represent XML comments.

method.name: contains
method.shortdesc: Checks if this XML object contains the given XML object.

parameter.name: xml
parameter.shortdesc: The XML to search for.

method.name: copy
method.shortdesc: Creates a copy of this XML object.

method.name: descendants
method.shortdesc: Returns all the XML-valued descendants of this XML object with the given name.
method.description: If the name parameter is omitted, returns all descendants of this XML object.

parameter.name: name
parameter.shortdesc: The name of the descendant to find.

method.name: elements
method.shortdesc: Returns a list of XML children that are elements with a given name, or all children that are XML elements.

parameter.name: name
parameter.shortdesc: The element name. If not supplied, gets all children that are XML elements.

method.name: hasComplexContent
method.shortdesc: Reports whether this XML object contains complex content.
method.description: An XML object is considered to contain complex content if it represents an XML element that has child elements. XML objects representing attributes, comments, processing instructions and text nodes do not have complex content. The existence of attributes, comments, processing instructions and text nodes within an XML object is not significant in determining if it has complex content.

method.name: hasSimpleContent
method.shortdesc: Reports whether this XML object contains simple content.
method.description: An XML object is considered to contain simple content if it represents a text node, represents an attribute node or if it represents an XML element that has no child elements. XML objects representing comments and processing instructions do not have simple content. The existence of attributes, comments, processing instructions and text nodes within an XML object is not significant in determining if it has simple content.

method.name: inScopeNamespaces
method.shortdesc: Returns an array of Namespace objects mirroring the current list of valid namespaces at this element.
method.description: The last element of the returned array is the default namespace.

method.name: insertChildAfter
method.shortdesc: Inserts the given child2 after the given child1 in this XML object and returns this XML object.
method.description: If child1 is null, the method inserts child2 before all children of this XML object (that is, after none of them). If child1 does not exist in this XML object, the method returns without modifying this XML object.

parameter.name: child1
parameter.shortdesc: The child to insert the other child after.
parameter.description: If null, the method inserts child2 before all children of this XML object.

parameter.name: child2
parameter.shortdesc: The XML to insert.

method.name: insertChildBefore
method.shortdesc: Inserts the given child2 before the given child1 in this XML object and returns this XML object.
method.description: If child1 is null, the method inserts child2 after all children of this XML object (that is, before none of them). If child1 does not exist in this XML object, the method returns without modifying this XML object.

parameter.name: child1
parameter.shortdesc: The child to search for.
parameter.description: If null, the method inserts child2 after all children of this XML object.

parameter.name: child2
parameter.shortdesc: The XML to insert.

method.name: length
method.shortdesc: Returns the number of elements contained in an XML list. If this XML object is not a list, returns 1.

method.name: localName
method.shortdesc: Returns the local name of this XML object.
method.description: This value corresponds to the element name unless the name has a namespace prefix. For example, if the element has the name "ns:tag", the return value is "tag".

method.name: name
method.shortdesc: Returns a QName object containing the URI and the local name of the element.

method.name: namespace
method.shortdesc: Returns a Namespace object containing the namespace URI of the current element.

method.name: namespaceDeclarations
method.shortdesc: Returns an array containing all namespace declarations of this XML object.

method.name: nodeKind
method.shortdesc: Returns the type of this XML object as one of the strings "element", "attribute", "comment", "processing-instruction", or "text".

method.name: normalize
method.shortdesc: Puts all text nodes in this and all descendant XML objects into a normal form by merging adjacent text nodes and eliminating empty text nodes. Returns this XML object.

method.name: parent
method.shortdesc: Returns the parent object of this XML object.
method.description: The root object, as returned by the XML constructor, does not have a parent and returns null. Note that the E4X standard does not define what happens if this XML object is a list containing elements with multiple parents.

method.name: processingInstructions
method.shortdesc: Returns a list of preprocessing instructions.
method.description: Collects processing-instructions with the given name, if supplied. Otherwise, returns an XML list containing all the children of this XML object that are processing-instructions regardless of their name.

parameter.name: name
parameter.shortdesc: The name of the preprocessing instruction to return.

method.name: prependChild
method.shortdesc: Inserts a given child into this object before its existing XML properties, and returns this XML object.

parameter.name: child
parameter.shortdesc: The XML to insert.

method.name: removeNamespace
method.shortdesc: Removes the given namespace from this XML, and returns this XML.

parameter.name: namespace
parameter.shortdesc: The namespace to remove.

method.name: replace
method.shortdesc: Replaces the value of specified XML properties of this XML object returns this XML object.
method.description: This method acts like the assignment operator.

parameter.name: name
parameter.shortdesc: The property name.
parameter.description: Can be a numeric property name, a name for a set of XML elements, or the properties wildcard *. If this XML object contains no properties that match the name, the method returns without modifying this XML object.

parameter.name: value
parameter.shortdesc: The XML with which to replace the value of the matching property.
parameter.description: Can be an XML object, XML list or any value that can be converted to a String with toString().

method.name: setChildren
method.shortdesc: Replaces all of the XML-valued properties in this object with a new value, and returns this XML object.

parameter.name: value
parameter.shortdesc: The new value, which can be a single XML object or an XML list.

method.name: setLocalName
method.shortdesc: Replaces the local name of this XML object with a string constructed from the given name
method.description: The local name is any part behind a colon character. If there is no colon, it is the entire name.

parameter.name: name
parameter.shortdesc: The name to set.

method.name: setName
method.shortdesc: Replaces the name of this XML object with the given QName object.

parameter.name: name
parameter.shortdesc: The fully qualified name.

method.name: setNamespace
method.shortdesc: Sets the namespace for this XML element.
method.description: If the namespace has not been declared in the tree above this element, adds a namespace declaration.

parameter.name: namespace
parameter.shortdesc: The namespace to set.

method.name: text
method.shortdesc: Returns an XML list containing all XML properties of this XML object that represent XML text nodes.

method.name: toString
method.shortdesc: Returns the string representation of this object.
method.description: For text and attribute nodes, this is the textual value of the node; for other elements, this is the result of calling the toXMLString() method. If this XML object is a list, concatenates the result of calling toString() on each element.

method.name: toXMLString
method.shortdesc: Returns an XML-encoded string representation of this XML object.
method.description: Always includes the start tag, attributes and end tag of the XML object regardless of its content. It is provided for cases when the default XML to string conversion rules are not desired. Interprets the global settings XML.prettyPrint and XML.prettyIndent.

method.name: xpath
method.shortdesc: Evaluates the given XPath expression in accordance with the W3C XPath recommendation, using this XML object as the context node.

parameter.name: expr
parameter.shortdesc: The XPath expression to use.

classdef.name: XMLList
classdef.shortdesc: An XML list object.
classdef.description: In this implementation, an XMLList object is synonymous to the XML object. The constructor accepts an XML list, but everything else works like the XML object.

classdef.name: UnitValue
classdef.shortdesc: Represents a measurement as a combination of values and unit.
classdef.description: Note that this object is not available in all applications.

property.name: baseUnit
property.shortdesc: The base unit for all conversions.

property.name: type
property.shortdesc: The unit name.

property.name: value
property.shortdesc: The numeric value.

property.name: baseUnit
property.shortdesc: The base unit.

method.name: convert
method.shortdesc: Converts this instance to a different unit.

parameter.name: unitName
parameter.shortdesc: The unit name.

method.name: as
method.shortdesc: Returns this instance as a different unit.

parameter.name: unitName
parameter.shortdesc: The unit name.
